Love doesn't care about your physical appearance.. hormones or chemical reaction. Love goes beyond logical thinking.

From what I understand there are three stages to love. This is more specifically for sexual relationships as friend and family love is of course less sexually based.

Simply put
Obsession/crush: Sexual attraction, initial desire and interest in the other, mostly sexual based at least at first. If it is extreme, people often interpret this as being in-love, but often it doesn't have oxytocin and vasopressin levels required to be called in-love.

In-love: Looking into each others eyes, often having a us against the world ideals and feelings. Can last 6 months to 3 years.Given that this stage doesn't allow you to see faults very well in the other, it can be difficult if when one falls out of love, suddenly reality comes crashing down. This also explains why one night stands or casual relationships are not for everyone as some people have a quicker ability to fall in love, particularly during orgasm or other intimate relations with the person. (And yes, this explains why your friend might be boyfriend/girlfriend or even married to someone who clearly is not a good influence, being in-love is pretty blind for many people.)

Long-term love: Looking in the same direction, facing things and growing together. This stage is one many relationships do not reach. It's that one where you see the person clearly angry with the other, yet still holding the umbrella in the rain for the person while getting drenched themselves.

I disagree that love is a drug. It can be painful, and certainly impractical. This may be due to the challenge we all face when we love someone (friend, significant other, pet) and that person is suffering, or refuses to return the love. However, we still love because we realize it is the driving force that gives meaning to life.

While I appreciate the scientific and neurophysiology related to love, I wonder about how love originates.  Not just physical attraction, but the kind of love for a parent, friend, pet, or person who we don't even know well. It would also seem that there is a clear subconscious component to love. it is one aspect of our consciousness that we have no control over.  We can choose to avoid or pursue relationships, but when love finds us we can't predict it.

You know when cats get scared and their hair sticks up and they stretch out to look bigger? Well, a lot of mammals have this reflex - it's a response to attempt to scare off negative stimuli. Humans have been called "the hairless monkeys" because we tend to have less hair than most primates. Even though we have less hair, our bodies still want our hair to raise as a reflexive response to negative stimuli (i.e. feeling the hair on the back of your neck LITERALLY stand on end when you're scared.)

Teeth are not bone. Tooth tissue is formed by embryonic cells differentiating into cell types that later form the layers of the tooth and creating hard substances, which basically kills/uses up the embryonic cells.  As soon as the tooth surfaces there's no longer embryonic cells around it, although there are around the root, helping the root to finish forming, until it runs out of embryonic cells. Also, You only have enough cells for two sets of teeth, which is why we don't have unlimited teeth.
